subject: Re: [junit] Problems with New JUnit 3.6 and HTTPUnit
msgSnippet: ... Paul Using the new JUnit 3.6, along with the latest HTTPUnit Paul 1.2.3 and JTidy (20 Dec 2000), we get the following Paul exception when trying to run
messageBody:
>>>>> "Paul" == Paul Hodgetts <prh@...> writes:

Paul> Using the new JUnit 3.6, along with the latest HTTPUnit
Paul> 1.2.3 and JTidy (20 Dec 2000), we get the following
Paul> exception when trying to run some servlet unit tests:

Paul> java.lang.IllegalAccessError: try to access field
Paul> org.w3c.tidy.ParserImpl._parseHead from class
Paul> org.w3c.tidy.ParserImpl$ParseHTML

Paul> We haven't had a chance to debug this yet, but it seems some
Paul> sort of incompatibility was introduced in Junit 3.6. JUnit
Paul> 3.5 works fine.

Paul> Any ideas as to what might be going on?

Hi, Paul,

Did you try unchecking the box about reloading classes? I'm sure you
have, but it is worth mentioning. This behavior looks like what we saw
previously when we upgraded to 3.5 this past February.

bab


--
Brian Button bbutton@...
